title: China to hold first forum on sustainability in the cosmetics industry - Premium beauty
summary: China will host the first International Forum on Beauty Economy and Green Innovation in July 2023. The forum will focus on green innovation in the cosmetics and household chemical industries, discussing topics like environmental management, green materials, and eco-design. The event aims to promote green transformation in the industry and build an international exchange platform.

title: Manufacturing and the Circular Economy | ASSEMBLY - Assembly Magazine
summary: BMW is leading two projects to improve the circularity of automotive manufacturing. The Car2Car project aims to increase the quality and quantity of recycled materials from end-of-life vehicles by using digital technology and AI to automate and improve recycling processes. BMW is also leading the Future Sustainable Car Materials project, which focuses on developing innovative processes and materials for sustainable use of secondary materials.

title: Bringing sustainable supply chain practices to Africa - Businessday
summary: The article emphasizes the importance of sustainable supply chain practices for environmental protection. It highlights various strategies like using recycled materials, improving packaging efficiency, and communicating sustainability initiatives to consumers. These practices aim to reduce carbon footprint, minimize plastic pollution, and enhance overall supply chain efficiency while ensuring social and environmental responsibility.

title: Zouk Launches Flagship Store at Nexus Seawoods, Mumbai - Indian Retailer
summary: The Indian beauty and personal care market is experiencing a boom, with both online and offline brands witnessing significant growth. Companies like SUGAR Cosmetics, The Body Shop, Plum, Colorbar, Kapiva, Earth Rhythm, ARATA, BlushBee, Crazy Owl, Pilgrim, iluvia Professional, and many others are expanding their product lines, expanding into new markets, and embracing innovative technologies to cater to the changing demands of consumers. The sector is projected to grow at a CAGR of 11 percent over the next five years, driven by factors like rising disposable incomes, increasing awareness of personal care, and the growing popularity of online shopping.
